Post.title: ubuntu18.04 mysql
Post._content:
## 1

```shell
# MySQL,
dpkg -l | grep mysql

#
sudo apt-get update 
#mysql
sudo apt-get install mysql-server  

# mysql
service mysql start
service mysql stop
```



## 2

```shell
# 
sudo netstat -tap | grep mysql

# mysql
# -u  -p mysqlEnter password:mysql
mysql -u root -p


```

```shell
# sqoopMySQLsqoopcharacter_set_serverlatin1 set character_set_server=utf8;
mysql -u root -p

# MySQL
mysql> show variables like "char%";
```

![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/1.png)

```shell
# [mysqld]character_set_server=utf8
sudo vi /etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf
# MySQL
service mysql restart
```

![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/2.png)

```shell
# 
mysql -u root -p
# MySQL
# sqoopMySQLubuntumysql
mysql> show variables like "char%";
```

![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/3.png)

```shell
# mysql
systemctl status mysql
```

![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/4.png)

```shell
# mysql
mysql -u root -p
Enter password:

mysql> use mysql; 
# mysql
mysql> show tables; 
#user
mysql> select * from user;
usermysql
```



![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/5.png)



## 3



```shell
# mysql /etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf 
vim /etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf
# bind-address          = 127.0.0.1
```



![img](mysql-install-ubuntu18.04/6.png)



```shell
mysql -u root -p
# 
mysql> grant all on *.* to root@'%' identified by 'ars123456' with grant option;

# 
mysql> grant all on *.* to root@'127.0.0.1' identified by 'ars123456' with grant option;
mysql> grant all on *.* to root@'localhost' identified by 'ars123456' with grant option;
# 
mysql> flush privileges;    
mysql> exit
```

Post.title: ubuntu18.04 redis
Post._content:
# Redis 

RedisUbuntu 18.04Redis

1.  Redis
2. Redis 
3. Redis 

##  Redis

 apt  Ubuntu  Redis

```shell
$ sudo apt update
$ sudo apt install redis-server
```

## Redis 

 Redis

```shell
$ sudo vi /etc/redis/redis.conf
```

supervised initRedis supervisedno  systemd initUbuntusystemd 

```shell
# If you run Redis from upstart or systemd, Redis can interact with your
# supervision tree. Options:
#   supervised no      - no supervision interaction
#   supervised upstart - signal upstart by putting Redis into SIGSTOP mode
#   supervised systemd - signal systemd by writing READY=1 to $NOTIFY_SOCKET
#   supervised auto    - detect upstart or systemd method based on
#                        UPSTART_JOB or NOTIFY_SOCKET environment variables
# Note: these supervision methods only signal "process is ready."
#       They do not enable continuous liveness pings back to your supervisor.
supervised systemd
```

Redis

```shell
$ sudo service redis restart
```

 Redis 

```shell
$ sudo systemctl status redis
```



```shell
Active:active (running)
```

Redis

## Redis 

### redis 

 redis 

```shell
$ sudo service redis start
```

 redis 

```shell
$ sudo service redis stop
```

 redis 

```shell
$ sudo service redis restart
```

### redis 

 redis 

```shell
$ redis-cli
```

### redis 



```shell
$ sudo vi /etc/redis/redis.conf
```

 bind 127.0.0.1 ::1  bind 0.0.0.0

 redis

## Redis 

 Redis 

```shell
$ sudo vi /etc/redis/redis.conf
```



```shell
# requirepass foobared 
```

:

```shell
requirepass 123456
```
